result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik L Gomez-Hanson in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  
Victim is present in the hearing room, indicates defendant has been attempting to contact them. 
State requests the court order the defendant not contact the victim under any circumstances or the State can file contempt charges. 
BTC: Defendant ordered not to contact victim of case personally, or through anyone else. 
Defendant does not have counsel at this time. Has counsel on his pending misdemeanors, SPD has not appointed her on his felony file.
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits to give SPD time to appoint.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
from SPD, no attorney appointment as of today.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim H.S(person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Erik L Gomez-Hanson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Elizabeth Martha Angove appeared by video for Erik L Gomez-Hanson. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
